ETYMOLOGY: From Latin *cursor* 'runner', from *currere* 'to run'. The sense of a movable indicator on a scientific instrument dates from the mid-17th century; the computing sense developed in the 1960s.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A movable indicator on a computer display, used to show the current position for input (e.g., text entry) or to select items.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 计算机屏幕上的一个可移动指示符，用于显示当前输入位置（如文本输入）或选择项目。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Move the cursor over the link and click to open the page.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 将光标移到链接上方，然后单击以打开页面。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A transparent slide or line on a calculating instrument or measuring device (such as a slide rule or a vernier caliper) that indicates a position or reading.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 计算仪器或测量设备（如计算尺或游标卡尺）上的透明滑动指示器或线，用于指示位置或读数。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The engineer carefully aligned the cursor of the vernier caliper to get an accurate measurement.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 工程师仔细对齐游标卡尺的游标，以获得精确的测量。

REGISTER: General, with technical usage in computing and measurement.
